page.title: 13Childrens' Games
page.content: In a survey of the children in Midsomer Norton, it was found that the most popular game played at school was football followed by rounders and other ball games. At home, the most popular game was tennis, which is mainly played in the road or in gardens, or sometimes at the courts of the local secondary school. One interesting game that some children play at home is called "Kerby". To play Kerby you need 2 players, a ball (which can be larg or small) and a place with a kerb on each side of the road. One player stands on each side of the road and throws the ball at the opposite kerb. If it hits the kerb and bounces back that is a "kerb" (one point). The winner has to get 10 kerbs to win.
